articles.description: Lewis Hamilton insists he "still loves" Formula 1 after his most challenging weekend of his Ferrari career so far at the Hungarian Grand Prix.
articles.title: Hungarian Grand Prix: Why did Lewis Hamilton say he was useless?

articles.description: Thirty five runs or four wickets means England have a long night staring into the soul, writes chief cricket reporter Stephan Shemilt.
articles.title: England vs India: '35 runs or four wickets - rest well, if you can'

articles.description: American sprinter Sha'Carri Richardson fails to make the 200m finals of the USA Track and Field Championships, one week after being arrested.
articles.title: Sha'Carri Richardson misses out on 200m World Championship spot a week after arrest

articles.description: British and Irish Lions centre Bundee Aki reveals his wife Kayla gave birth in a car on the way to the hospital just before the first Test.
articles.title: British and Irish Lions 2025: Bundee Aki baby born in car before Test

articles.description: Lando Norris admits after his victory in the Hungarian Grand Prix that he was "not making life very easy" for himself in his title battle with team-mate Oscar Piastri.
articles.title: Hungarian Grand Prix: Lando Norris - 'I'm not making life easy'

articles.description: Miyu Yamashita produces an almost faultless final round to hold off England's Charley Hull and win the Women's Open at Royal Porthcawl.
articles.title: Women's Open 2025: Miyu Yamashita wins first major title at Royal Porthcawl

articles.description: All-rounder Chris Woakes is "all in" on helping England secure a series win over India despite a shoulder injury, says Joe Root.
articles.title: England vs India: Chris Woakes 'all in' and will bat if needed in fifth Test, says Joe Root

articles.description: Naomi Osaka loses just one game as she defeats Anastasija Sevastova  to reach the Canadian Open quarter-finals in Montreal.
articles.title: Canadian Open: Naomi Osaka and Madison Keys reach quarter-finals

articles.description: Netherlands defender Jorrel Hato signs seven-year contract with Chelsea after completing £37m transfer from Ajax.
articles.title: Jorrel Hato: Chelsea sign Ajax defender for £37m on seven-year contract

articles.description: Manchester United manager Ruben Amorim on last season's difficulties, his relationship with Sir Jim Ratcliffe and his hopes for the new season.
articles.title: Ruben Amorim: Man Utd boss feared going to games last season during form struggles
